identificationModule.briefTitle: Closed-Loop Transcranial Alternating Current Stimulation for the Treatment of Depression
identificationModule.officialTitle: Closed-Loop Transcranial Alternating Current Stimulation for the Treatment of Depression (CLACS): Single-Site Open-Label Pilot Study

collaborators.name: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this research study is to study closed-loop transcranial alternating current stimulation (tACS) to determine its effects on symptoms of depression in people with major depressive disorder.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
The purpose of this clinical trial is to investigate the preliminary efficacy of closed-loop tACS for the treatment of major depressive disorder (MDD) in an open-label pilot study. We will recruit up to 35 participants with unipolar, non-psychotic MDD. Participation will include seven visits, two of them remotely (with an in-person option as needed), and one electronic survey.

Potential participants fill-in an electronic pre-screening form. If potentially eligible, a remote screening visit is performed. If eligible, participants attend five consecutive, daily stimulation sessions. Clinical assessments will be performed at baseline (Day 1 of stimulation, D1), Day five of stimulation (D5), and at their follow-up visit (14 days after the completion of stimulation, FU2) using the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS-17).

For a subset of patients, electroencephalography (EEG) is collected at D1 prior to stimulation and after stimulation and again at FU2.

For a subset of patients, self-scoring surveys will be sent bi-weekly until 12 weeks after treatment.

armGroups.label: Closed-loop tACS
armGroups.description: Closed-loop individual alpha tACS daily for five consecutive days.

primaryOutcomes.description: Change in HDRS-17 between two week follow-up (FU2) and Day 1 (D1); minimum value is 0, maximum value is 52. Higher scores indicate worse outcome.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in HDRS-17 between D5 and D1
Number of response/remission rates at D5 and FU2

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Quick Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology (QIDS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in QIDS at D5, FU1, FU2; minimum value is 0, maximum value is 27. Higher scores indicate worse outcome.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Altman Self-Rating Mania Scale (ASRM)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in ASRM at D5, FU1, FU2; minimum value is 0, maximum value is 20. Higher scores indicate worse outcome.
Change in SHAPS at D5, FU1, FU2; minimum value is 0, maximum value is 14. Higher scores indicate worse outcome.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Depression Anxiety and Stress Scale (DASS-42)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in DASS-42 at D5, FU1, FU2; minimum value is 0, maximum value is 126 with three subscales (0 to 42). Higher scores indicate worse outcome.
Change in STAI at D5, FU1, FU2; minimum value is 20, maximum value is 80. Higher scores indicate worse outcome.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Quality of Life Enjoyment and Satisfaction Questionnaire, short form (Q-LES-Q-SF)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in Q-LES-Q-SF at D5, FU1, FU2; minimum value is 14, maximum value is 70. Higher scores indicate better outcome.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Clinical Global Impression Scale (CGI)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in CGI at Day 5, and FU2; CGI scale contains two scoring components, 1) Severity of Illness (0-7) and 2) Global Improvement (0-7). Higher scores in component 1 indicate worse symptoms while higher numbers in component 2 indicate worse clinical outcomes.

otherOutcomes.description: Change in EEG alpha oscillation power at D1 pre-stimulation, D1 post-stimulation, and FU2.

otherOutcomes.measure: Change in Quick Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology (QIDS) Over 12 Weeks
otherOutcomes.description: Change in QIDS at four week follow-up (FU3), six week follow-up (FU4), eight week follow-up (FU5), ten week follow-up (FU6), and twelve week follow-up (FU7); minimum value is 0, maximum value is 27. Higher scores indicate worse outcome.

otherOutcomes.measure: Change in Altman Self-Rating Mania Scale (ASRM) Over 12 Weeks
otherOutcomes.description: Change in ASRM at FU3, FU4, FU5, FU6, and FU7; minimum value is 0, maximum value is 20. Higher scores indicate worse outcome.

otherOutcomes.measure: Change in Snaith-Hamilton Pleasure Scale (SHAPS) Over 12 Weeks
otherOutcomes.description: Change in SHAPS at FU3, FU4, FU5, FU6, and FU7; minimum value is 0, maximum value is 14. Higher scores indicate worse outcome.

otherOutcomes.measure: Change in Depression Anxiety and Stress Scale (DASS-42) Over 12 Weeks
otherOutcomes.description: Change in DASS-42 at FU3, FU4, FU5, FU6, and FU7; minimum value is 0, maximum value is 126 with three subscales (0 to 42). Higher scores indicate worse outcome.

otherOutcomes.measure: Change in State-Train Anxiety Inventory (STAI) Over 12 Weeks
otherOutcomes.description: Change in STAI at FU3, FU4, FU5, FU6, and FU7; minimum value is 20, maximum value is 80. Higher scores indicate worse outcome.

otherOutcomes.measure: Change in Quality of Life Enjoyment and Satisfaction Questionnaire, short form (Q-LES-Q-SF)
otherOutcomes.description: Change in Q-LES-Q-SF at FU3, FU4, FU5, FU6, and FU7; minimum value is 14, maximum value is 70. Higher scores indicate better outcome.
Change in HDRS-17 between six week follow up (FU4) and D1

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Ages 18-70 years
* Diagnostic and Statistical Manual, 5th Edition (DSM-5) diagnosis of MDD; unipolar, non-psychotic
* Hamilton Rating Depression Rating Scale (HRDS-17) score \>8
* Low suicide risk as determined by the Columbia-Suicide Severity Rating Scale (C-SSRS) triage form (no intent or plan)
* Capacity to understand all relevant risks and potential benefits of the study (informed consent)

Exclusion Criteria:

* DSM-5 diagnosis of severe alcohol use disorder (AUD) within the last 12 months.
* DSM-5 diagnosis of moderate to severe substance use disorder (excluding tobacco) within the last 12 months.
* Lifetime history of bipolar disorder, psychotic disorder, schizophrenia, autism
* Current use of benzodiazepines \> 20mg diazepam/d equivalent
* Antidepressant dose change within the last 2 weeks
* Initiated new antidepressant within the last 4 weeks

overallOfficials.name: David R Rubinow, MD
overallOfficials.affiliation: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

references.citation: Alexander ML, Alagapan S, Lugo CE, Mellin JM, Lustenberger C, Rubinow DR, Frohlich F. Double-blind, randomized pilot clinical trial targeting alpha oscillations with transcranial alternating current stimulation (tACS) for the treatment of major depressive disorder (MDD). Transl Psychiatry. 2019 Mar 5;9(1):106. doi: 10.1038/s41398-019-0439-0.
